channel.title: Do you MIDI / BlueTooth (if so) what’s your tool?
channel.description:
I’m not sure if this is an Auxy worthy question or not. Mostly cause I don’t know if Auxy really supports Bluetooth keyboards.
But for those who do use that type of gear... what are you finding useful for iPad music production?

item.title: Do you MIDI / BlueTooth (if so) what’s your tool?
item.dc:creator: NickElle
item.description:
Novation Launckey Mini works great with iOS. It’s small and light, and with the camera connection kit, all it takes is a synth app, and you’re set!

Also, with iOS 11, you can sync your iOS device with your computer over MIDI/audio, so you could use ANY MIDI controller to control your device, with the use of a DAW.
It’s a pretty neat trick, and I’m SO glad Apple implemented it.

Read full topic
item.source: Do you MIDI / BlueTooth (if so) what’s your tool?

item.title: Do you MIDI / BlueTooth (if so) what’s your tool?
item.dc:creator: blakkaz
item.description:
iammane:

The only BT stuff I know of really though is the Korg stuff and the Roli stuff… I’m sure there’s others, but nothing I’m remembering off the top of my head :\

Akai have a few models and there is also the CME Xkey Air.
I can vouch for the Akai stuff, and the Xkey is pretty well regarded.

Read full topic
item.source: Do you MIDI / BlueTooth (if so) what’s your tool?

item.title: Do you MIDI / BlueTooth (if so) what’s your tool?
item.dc:creator: iammane
item.description:
Very nice. Back in the day I had an MAudio Oxygen 61, but to be honest, I never used the sliders, it didn’t have pads and it had 8 knobs but I never used more than two at a time, usually no more than 4 per song in Reason. This piece looks really nice.

The only BT stuff I know of really though is the Korg stuff and the Roli stuff… I’m sure there’s others, but nothing I’m remembering off the top of my head :\

Read full topic
item.source: Do you MIDI / BlueTooth (if so) what’s your tool?
